heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 21 September 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (187°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (233.0°) by approximately 46.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 3.5°C), outside temperature (down 3.2°C), and inside temperature (down 1.6°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 7%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 6662 lux), pressure (down 8 mbar), and cloud levels (up 607 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 8030 lux) and cloud levels (up 155 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 606.9m lower than yesterday, 173.3m higher than the past week, 154.7m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 1104m to a maximum of 3920m, averaging 1656.0m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1482.7m and 1810.7m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: The clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and near calm conditions. Showers, the clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected, and a mix of sun and clouds. No significant shifts in the weather are expected.
